episode_title: 312 - The One With All The Jealousy

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is getting ready for her first day.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Hey. Umm. Does everybody hate these shoes?
content.parenthetical: running in from her bedroom, wearing only a towel

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, but don’t worry. I don’t think anybody’s gonna focus on that as long as your wearing that towel dress.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Tell him.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s her first day at this new job. Your not supposed to start with her!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, I suppose I can wait a day. Hey, what are you doing Friday?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I need you to come to this bachelor party for my weird cousin Albert, y’know he’s the botanist.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh God. Y’know, botanists are such geeks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. Is that a dinosaur tie?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hmm? Oh, yeah. (he makes a growling sound)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Morning. Rach, I’m here with the purses!
content.parenthetical: entering, with about 20 purses hanging around her neck

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It must take you forever to find your keys.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you, thank you, thank you, Pheebs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Your welcome, oh please not the one with the turtles.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, no, no, no turtles scare me. I don’t need that today.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Honey, just relax, it’s gonna be fine. Hey, umm,. why don’t I come down there and I’ll take you out to lunch?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh honey, thank you, but Mark’s taking me out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mark is that ah, the same Mark that helped you get the job?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, it’s kinda like a ‘good luck on your first day’ sort of thing. (to Phoebe) Is this actually a lunchbox?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, no, it’s a purse. And there’s a thermos in it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, so can you make it on Friday?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? Oh yeah, yeah I think so. Why am I invited to this again?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well apparently Albert has no friends. He’s very excited about the bachelor party though. I think actually the only reason he’s getting married is so he can see a stripper.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: A stripper at a bachelor party, that is so clich�. Why don’t you get a magician?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, if the magician can open my beer with his but cheeks, then all right.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Ross and Chandler are entering, Joey is on the phone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She’s having lunch with him. She’s having lunch with him. And you should of seen the hug she gave him when she got the job. And, and, and, (to Joey) he’s really good looking. (Joey gives an enthusiastic thumbs up) What am I gonna do?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Don’t do anything. Keep it inside. Learn how to hide your feelings! (pause) Don’t cry outloud.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes! Guess who’s in an audition for a Broadway musical?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I want to say you but, that seems like such an easy answer.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It is me! It’s a musical version of Tale of Two Cities . So I think I’m gonna sing New York, New York , and ah, oh I left My Heart in San Francisco .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah Joey, I don’t think you get to pick the cities.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mr. Dickens gets to pick ’em.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ll get you the Cliff Notes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The what?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The abridgment.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, okay. (to Ross) The what?

content.description: Rachel’s office, Mark is training Rachel.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: …and the style number, and the invoice number, and the shipping date. Good. Any questions so far?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. What kind of discount do we get?

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Twenty percent.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh!! I love this job! (her phone rings) Wow! My first call.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Here, let me. (answers phone) Rachel Green’s line, how may I help you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi, is Rachel there?

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: And who may I say is calling?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This is Ross?

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Ross of…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Of Ross and Rachel.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Oh hi. It’s, it’s Mark.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh hey, hey Mark.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Hey, hold on a second.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi honey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi! What’s ah, what’s Mark doing answering your phone?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, he’s just goofing around.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohhhhh yeah, that’s, that’s funny. Why ah, why isn’t he goofing around in his own office?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh honey, this is his office too. I told you we’re Joanna’s two assistants.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why does Joanna need two assistants, how, how lazy is she?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Oh my God! What did I just do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I think I just shipped 3,000 bras to personnel. Oh honey, I gotta go. (to Mark) Mark, I need you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, bye-bye. (starts slamming the receiver down in anger.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ow! Ross!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, oh, I’m, I’m, I’m sorry sweetie, I was just trying to ah, I’m dialing another number. (hangs up)

content.description: The Moondance diner, Monica is cleaning up with one of the waiters, with her back turned to him she removes her fake breasts and hides them under her wig.

content.speaker: Jeannine
content.text: All right, I just got changed in thirty seconds so you can be alone with him. You’d better go for it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Please, I’m not going for anything.

content.speaker: Jeannine
content.text: Well, if you don’t, I will.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Would you please go?

content.speaker: Jeannine
content.text: Night Mon. Night Julio.

content.speaker: Julio
content.text: Adios.
(Monica starts wiping down the stools, as Julio follows along behind her replacing the napkin holders.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look Julio, someone left their book here.

content.speaker: Julio
content.text: Ah actually, that is mine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah, what are you reading?

content.speaker: Julio
content.text: Flowers of Evil, by Beaudalire. Have you read it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Have I read it? (pause) No, are you enjoying it?

content.speaker: Julio
content.text: I thought I would, but the translation’s no good.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Your a poet and don’t know it. (she turns away and makes a face like ‘I can’t believe I just said that.’)

content.speaker: Julio
content.text: Actually I ah, I am a poet.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, then you do know it. (pause) So um what kind of things do you write about?

content.speaker: Julio
content.text: Things that move me. The, the shadow of a tree, a child laughing, or this lip. (points to her lip)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Mine? (points to her lower lip) Right here?

content.speaker: Julio
content.text: I can write an epic poem about this lip. (grabs her lower lip)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How would that go? (they kiss) Well, it didn’t rhyme, but I liked it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’ve got to pick a pocket or two. Boyyyyssss, (picks a handkerchief from the pianist’s pocket) you’ve got to pick a pocket or two……

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Lovely, just lovely.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really? Thanks.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Listen Joey, we definitely want to see you for the callback on Saturday.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Excellent, I’ll be there.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Okay, and listen don’t forget to bring your jazz shoes for the dance audition.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahhh! My ah, my agent said it wasn’t a dancing part.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Joey, all the roles got to dance a little. But believe me with your dance background it’ll be a piece of cake.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is reading Joey’s resume.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …three years of modern dance with Twila Tharp! Five years with the American Ballet Theater?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, everybody lies on their resume, okay. I wasn’t one of the Zoom Kids either.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, can you dance at all?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I can dance, y’know. (starts to dance really, really, really badly)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no, no, no, no.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What, what is that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure, it looks stupid now, there’s no music playing.
(phone rings)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, I have to get that, but no-no. (answering phone) Hello? (listens) (happily) Hi! Yeah listen, I’m, I’m in need of a stripper and I was told that you do that. (listens) Let me ask you this, what, what do you do for the extra hundred? (listens) So would I, would I have to provide the grapes?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, how was last night with Julio, senorita?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It was soo amazing, he is so sexy, and smart, which makes him even sexier. Oh gosh, I gotta so you this. Last night, we were fooling around and he stops to write a poem.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Get out! I couldn’t stop if a meteor hit me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, we have our stripper. A miss Crystal Chandelier.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well sure, you name a kid that, what do you expect them to grow up to be?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Anyway um, when he left he forgot to take the poem with him. Now, I am like totally dense about poetry, but I think it’s pretty good all right. Check it out. (hands them the poem)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The Empty Vase. Translucent beauty…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: To yourself. (finishing) Hey-hey-hey, y’know what that’s pretty good.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh good, I think so too. Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I’m so glad you guys like it. Yay! All right I gotta go to work. (tries to take the poem)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa, I’m not done.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, just give it back to me when your done. See you guys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bye-bye.
(Monica leaves)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God, oh my God! Poor Monica!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What, what, what?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?! He was with her when he wrote this poem. Look, (reading) ’my vessel so empty with nothing inside. Now that I’ve touched you, you seem emptier still.’ He thinks Monica is empty, she is the empty vase!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You really think that is what he meant?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, totally. Oh, God, oh, she seemed so happy too.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Done.

content.description: Rachel’s office, her desk is covered with stuff Ross has sent her.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Do you have the, the Ralph Lauren file?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, yeah, sure, it’s umm… (she picks up this bug and it starts to play the theme from Love Story)

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Wh-what’s that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s from Ross, it’s a love bug.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Wow! Somebody wants people to know you have a boyfriend.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no, no-no-no, that’s not, not, not, what he is doing. He’s just, he’s just really romantic.

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Ah, excuse me, are you Rachel Green?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Man
content.text: One, two, three…
content.parenthetical: being joined by the rest of the barbershop quartet

content.speaker: Quartet
content.text: Congratulations on your first week at your brand new job! It won’t be long before your the boss.

content.speaker: The Bass Barber
content.text: Omm-pah, omm-pah, omm-pah.

content.speaker: Quartet
content.text: And you know who will be there to support… you?! Your one and only boyfriend…

content.speaker: The Bass Barber
content.text: It’s nice to have a boyfriend.

content.speaker: Quartet
content.text: Your loyal loving boyfriend Ross… Ross!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross and Rachel are entering the living room from her bedroom.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m hurt! I’m actually hurt, that you would think that I would send you any of those things out of any thing other than love. Hurt! Hurt!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right Ross!! I get it!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I mean my God…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re hurt!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …can’t, can’t a guy send a barbershop quartet to his girlfriend’s office anymorrrrre!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, please, Ross it was so obvious! It was like you were marking your territory. I mean you might have well have just come in and peed all around my desk!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I would never do that!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look, I know what’s going on here, okay, Mark explained it all to me. He said this is what you guys do.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah well if, if, if Mark said that, than Mark’s an idiot.

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Ross, Joey are there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Mark’s a genius!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why?! How?! How is he a genius?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, don’t you see what’s happening here. Instead of hitting on her right away, he’s becoming her confidant. Now he’s gonna be the guy she goes too to complain about you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What am I going to do?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, why don’t you send her a musical bug, op, no you already did that. All right look, you’re going to have to go there yourself now, okay, make a few surprise visits.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know you guys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right fine, don’t do anything, just sit here and talk to us, meanwhile she is talking to him about you. And he’s being Mr. Joe Sensitive, and she starts thinking ’maybe this is the guy for me, because he understands me.’

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And before you know it, she’s with him. And you’ll be all, ‘Ohh, man!’ And he’ll be all, ‘Yes!’ And us, we’ll be like, ‘Wh-whoa, dude.’ And pretty soon you’ll be like, (sadly) ‘Hhiii,’ and, and, and, ‘I can’t go, Rachel and Mark might be there.’ And we’ll be like, ’man get over it, it’s been four years!!’

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He paints quite a picture doesn’t he?

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Here’s the Shelly Siegal stuff from December.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: And wait, I’ve got something for you. (kisses her)

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Mark!!

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: It’s okay, Rachel knows.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Yeah, but even soo.
(Ross appears in the hallway just outside of Rachel’s office.)

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: I can’t help it, I’m just, I’m just crazy about you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhh! That is soo sweet! (gets up to get herself a cup of coffee)
(Ross is eavesdropping in the hallway.)

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Okay, okay look, I know I’m being Mr. Inappropriate today, but it’s just so tough, I mean see you walking around and I just wanna touch you and hold you, come on no one’s around, just, just kiss me.
(They start to kiss, and Ross rushes into the office to break it up.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right that’s, that’s it!! Get off her!

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: What is going on?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s going on?! (throws the love bug at him) That’s what’s going on!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross!
(Ross finally looks at the woman kissing Mark.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I have been down in your store for twenty minutes trying to get a tie! What do I have to do to get some service?! (turns to Rachel) Hi Rach. (He’s puts his hand on her shoulder and she knocks it away.)

content.description: Joey’s dance audition, Joey is warming up.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Ah Joey. Joey Tribbiani. Listen Joey, I got a problem, I just got a call from my dance captain, he’s having a relationship crisis and can’t get out of Long Island.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, does that mean the audition is off?

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Listen Joey, seeing as you’ve got the most experience, I want you to take these dancers and show them the combination.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Aw come on Joey, it’s easy. Y’know, it’s hand, hand, head, head, (very quickly, Joey watches stunned) up, out a beret, out a beret, big turn here, grand dechant, desont, desont, slide back, step, step, step, and jazz hands!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s ah, step-ity, step and jazz hands.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Have fun.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Bye. (does the jazz hands)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is tying a ribbon to a vase.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What are you wrapping?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh-ho, look what I got Julio.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, it’s a vase.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, just like the one in the poem.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well not exactly like the one in the poem.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What do you mean?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Remember how you said you were really dense about poetry? Oh. (hugs her)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So! I’m just an empty vase, huh?

content.speaker: Julio
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know, so I don’t read as many important books as you do, and I don’t write trick poems that seem to be about one thing but are actually about something else. And y’know what, I get excited about stupid stuff, like when I my People magazine comes on Saturday, and the new Hold Everything catalog. Y’know but that does not mean that I’m empty, I care about things. I care about my friends and family. You have no right to make that kind of judgment about me.

content.speaker: Julio
content.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You don’t even know me…

content.speaker: Julio
content.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, the poem is not about you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Julio
content.text: The Empty Vase is not about you. My baby, you make me so sad that you would think this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry, my friend Phoebe…

content.speaker: Julio
content.text: No, it’s about all women. Well, all American women. You feel better now?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah.

content.description: Joey’s audition, the director has returned and wants to see the combination.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: All right, let’s do it!
(The group does the same horrible dance that Joey did earlier in the show, except they’re all out of sync and they do the jazz hands at the end.)

content.speaker: Director
content.text: No, no, no. What was that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know, it was the best I could get out of them.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Well, people!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: People, people, people.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Let’s try it again, and this time let’s watch everybody watch Joey. (to Joey) Show ’em how it’s done. (to the pianist) Count it off.
(The pianist starts to play, and Joey readies himself, and then runs out of the audition.)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler and Rachel are there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So ah, did you have fun at the bachelor party last night?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, yeah! Look what I got, look what I got. (holds up a pen) See, she’s fully dressed, right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And then you click it and, uh-oh, she’s naked. And then, and then you click it again and she’s dressed. She’s a business woman, she’s walking down the street, she’s window shopping, and (clicks pen) whoa-whoa-whoa, sh-she’s naked! (Rachel just stares at him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what, I’m, I’m gonna spend some alone time with the pen.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry, I was an idiot.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: A big idiot.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A big idiot. Just you have to realize is, this whole Mark thing is kinda hard for me.
(Gunther is eavesdropping in the background.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, why is it hard, I mean we’ve been together for almost a year now?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I was with Carol for like eight years and I lost her. And now if it’s possible I think I love you even more. So, it’s hard for me to believe that I’m not gonna, well that someone else is not going to take you away.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Let it be me! Let it be me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, that’s very sweet, it just seems to me though, that if two people love each other and trust each other, like we do, there’s no reason to be jealous. (she kisses him)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I gotta get going. Bye Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, okay Ross. Listen, this pen is kinda getting boring, so can you pick me up some porn?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Where ya going?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I’ve got to go pick up Ben, we’ve got a play date this afternoon.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, with who?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, just this woman that I met last night at the party.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: There was a woman at the… (realizes) The stripper?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You have a play date with a stripper?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Man, I gotta get a kid. (looks at the pen and starts laughing)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah, yeah, yeah. Umm, we started talking after she y’know, did her thing. And it turns out she’s got a boy about Ben’s age, so we’re taking them to a gym-boree class. Why, is that okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sure, is she married?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ahh, no.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. (starts shaking the sugar down in a packet really hard.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you jealous?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noo, I y’know I don’t see why she has to play with you, that’s all. I mean doesn’t she have any y’know other stripper moms friends of her own?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You are totally jealous.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not jealous. All right this is about, umm, people feeling certain things y’know about strippers. And y’know, and um, I…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Honey, I love you too.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh. Wait, wait, wait.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?
(She runs over and gives him a very passionate kiss.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, there’s a kiss that he won’t forget for a couple of hours, y’know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. Either that, or you just turned him on and sent him off to a stripper.

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Is there a Julio here?

content.speaker: Julio
content.text: I am Julio.
(The rest of barbershop quartet enters, and joins him.)

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Mister Pretensous, (Monica stands up in the background) you think there’s no one finer, well but your poems are unpublished, and you work in a diner.

content.speaker: Quartet
content.text: Your no God’s gift to women, that’s all in your headdddd. You are just a buttmunch.

content.speaker: The Bass Barber
content.text: No one likes a buttmunch.

content.speaker: Quartet
content.text: And your also bad in bedd-edd-edd!.
(Monica waves at Julio.)
